question.text:
Dr. John is a botanist, he is experimenting with exotic species of rose plant Rosa polyantha. He started with 40 plants, after a year 22 more plants were added through reproduction but also 14 plants died during the experimentation. Which of the following statements are correct?

1. The death rate is 0.35 % per year

2. The birth rate is 0.55 % per rose per year

3. The birth rate is 0.55 % per year

4. The death rate is 0.35% per rose per year

solution.text: By applying the formula: Birth rate = No. of births / Total population  <math><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>22</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi> </mi><mo>=</mo><mi> </mi><mn>0.55</mn></math>  per rose per year or  <math><mn>55</mn><mi>%</mi></math>  per year. Death rate = No. of Deaths / Total population  <math><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi> </mi><mo>=</mo><mi> </mi><mn>0.35</mn></math>  per rose per year or  <math><mn>35</mn><mi>%</mi></math>  per year. These rates are referred as per capita birth and death rates in a population.
